Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: By the end of Year 8, students analyse factors that influence identities, emotions and responses to change, and describe strategies to respond to these influences.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They analyse how stereotypes, respect, empathy and valuing diversity influence relationships.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students analyse the effectiveness of assertive communication strategies, protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies applied online and offline.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They analyse health information and messages to propose strategies that enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students apply and transfer movement skills and movement concepts across a range of situations.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They implement and evaluate the effectiveness of movement strategies on movement outcomes.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students propose and evaluate strategies designed to achieve personal health, fitness and wellbeing outcomes.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They select, use and refine strategies to support inclusion, fair play and collaboration across a range of movement contexts.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: By the end of Year 10, students propose and evaluate personal strategies to manage their identities, emotions and responses to change.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They evaluate how attitudes and beliefs about equality, respect, diversity and inclusion influence the nature and quality of relationships.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students propose and justify strategies to manage online and offline situations where their own or others’ health, safety, relationships or wellbeing may be at risk.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They synthesise health information from credible sources to propose and justify strategies to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students evaluate and refine their own and others’ movement skills and performances, and apply movement concepts in challenging or unfamiliar situations.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They adapt and transfer movement strategies to unfamiliar situations to achieve successful outcomes.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students propose and evaluate community-based physical activity interventions designed to improve the health, fitness and wellbeing of themselves and others.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They apply and evaluate leadership approaches, collaboration strategies and ethical behaviours across a range of movement contexts.
